descriptors.c

00001 #include "../headers/descriptors.h"
00002 
00003 /*
00004 
00005 ## GENERAL INFORMATION
00006 ##
00007 ## FILE                                         descriptors.c
00008 ## AUTHORS                                      P. Schmidtke and V. Le Guilloux
00009 ## LAST MODIFIED                        01-04-08
00010 ##
00011 ## SPECIFICATIONS
00012 ##
00013 ##      This file is used to calculate descriptors using a set of atoms
00014 ##      and/or alpha spheres, using structures defined in atoms.c and
00015 ##      voronoi/voronoi_lst.c.
00016 ##
00017 ##      
00018 ##
00019 ## MODIFICATIONS HISTORY
00020 ##
00021 ##      09-02-09        (v)  Maximum distance between two alpha sphere added
00022 ##      29-01-09        (v)  Normalized density and polarity score added
00023 ##      21-01-09        (v)  Density descriptor Added
00024 ##      14-01-09        (v)  Some normalized descriptors added
00025 ##      28-11-08        (v)  Comments UTD + relooking + mean_asph_ray set to float -_-'
00026 ##      01-04-08        (v)  Added comments and creation of history
00027 ##      01-01-08        (vp) Created (random date...)
00028 ##      
00029 ## TODO or SUGGESTIONS
00030 ##
00031 ##  (v) Some descriptors need urgent improvement (amino-acids volume 
00032 ##          score is the best example: maybe replace by the molecular weight 
00033 ##          for example, although the way we use this kind of descriptors 
00034 ##              might not be relevant at all anyway...)
00035 ##      (v) Possible improvement:
00036 ##              Use the sorted structure to calculate the apolar density.
00037 
00038 */
00039

00072 /**
00073    ## FUNCTION: 
00074         allocate_s_desc 
00075   
00076    ## SPECIFICATION: 
00077         Allocate a descroptor structure
00078   
00079    ## PARAMETRES:
00080   
00081    ## RETURN:
00082         s_desc*
00083   
00084 */
00085 s_desc* allocate_s_desc(void) 
00086 {
00087         s_desc *desc = (s_desc*)my_malloc(sizeof(s_desc)) ;
00088         
00089         reset_desc(desc) ;
00090 
00091         return desc ;
00092 }
00093 
00094 /**
00095    ## FUNCTION: 
00096         reset_s_desc
00097   
00098    ## SPECIFICATION: 
00099         Reset descriptors to 0 values.
00100   
00101    ## PARAMETRES:
00102   
00103    ## RETURN:
00104         void
00105   
00106 */
00107 void reset_desc(s_desc *desc)
00108 {
00109     desc->hydrophobicity_score = 0.0 ;
00110         desc->volume_score = 0.0 ;
00111         desc->volume = 0.0 ;
00112         desc->prop_polar_atm = 0.0 ;
00113         desc->mean_asph_ray = 0.0 ;
00114         desc->masph_sacc = 0.0 ;
00115         desc->apolar_asphere_prop = 0.0 ;
00116         desc->mean_loc_hyd_dens = 0.0 ;
00117         desc->as_density = 0.0 ;
00118         desc->as_max_dst = 0.0 ;
00119 
00120         desc->flex = 0.0 ;
00121         desc->nas_norm = 0.0 ;
00122         desc->prop_asapol_norm = 0.0 ;
00123         desc->mean_loc_hyd_dens_norm = 0.0 ;
00124         desc->as_density_norm = 0.0 ;
00125     desc->polarity_score_norm = 0.0 ;
00126         desc->as_max_dst_norm = 0.0 ;
00127 
00128         desc->nb_asph = 0 ;
00129         desc->polarity_score  = 0 ;
00130         desc->charge_score = 0 ;
00131 
00132         int i ;
00133         for(i = 0 ; i < 20 ; i++) desc->aa_compo[i] = 0 ;
00134 }
00135 
00136 /**
00137    ## FUNCTION: 
00138         set_descriptors
00139   
00140    ## SPECIFICATION: 
00141         Set descriptors using a set of atoms with corresponding voronoi vertices.
00142         Current descriptors (need to be improved...) includes atom/AA based descriptors
00143         and voronoi vertice based descriptors.
00144         A word on several descriptors:
00145                 - The "solvent accessibility" of a sphere (which is rather the buriedness
00146                   degree...) is defined as the distance of the barycenter of the sphere
00147                   (defined using the 4 contacted atoms) from the center of the sphere.
00148                 - The mean_loc_hyd_dens is the mean value of apolar density calculated
00149                   for each vertice and defined in the next function (see comments or doc)
00150    
00151   
00152    ## PARAMETRES:
00153         @ s_atm **atoms         : The list of atoms
00154         @ int natoms            : The number of atoms
00155         @ s_vvertice **tvert : The list of vertices
00156         @ int nvert             : The number of vertices
00157         @ s_desc *desc          : OUTPUT: The descriptor structure to fill
00158   
00159    ## RETURN:
00160     void: s_desc is filled
00161   
00162 */
00163 void set_descriptors(s_atm **atoms, int natoms, s_vvertice **tvert, int nvert,
00164                                          s_desc *desc,int niter)
00165 {
00166         /* Setting atom-based descriptors */
00167         set_atom_based_descriptors(atoms, natoms, desc) ;
00168 
00169         /* Setting vertice-based descriptors */
00170         if(! tvert) return ;
00171 
00172         float d = 0.0, vx, vy, vz, vrad,
00173                   masph_sacc = 0.0, /* Mean alpha sphere solvent accessibility */
00174                   mean_ashape_radius = 0.0,
00175                   as_density = 0.0, as_max_dst = -1.0,
00176                   dtmp = 0.0 ;
00177 
00178         int i, j,
00179                 napol_neigh = 0,
00180                 nAlphaApol = 0 ;
00181         
00182         float as_max_r = -1.0 ;
00183 
00184         s_vvertice *vcur = NULL,
00185                            *vc = NULL ;
00186 
00187         desc->mean_loc_hyd_dens = 0.0 ;
00188         for(i = 0 ; i < nvert ; i++) {
00189                 vcur = tvert[i] ;
00190                 if(vcur->ray > as_max_r) as_max_r = vcur->ray ;
00191 
00192                 vx = vcur->x ; vy = vcur->y ; vz = vcur->z ; vrad = vcur->ray ;
00193 
00194                 /* Calculate apolar density if necessary, and pocket density */
00195                 j = 0 ;
00196                 if(vcur->type == M_APOLAR_AS) {
00197                         napol_neigh = 0 ;
00198                         for(j = 0 ; j < nvert ; j++) {
00199                                 vc = tvert[j] ;
00200 
00201                                 /* Increment the number of apolar neighbor */
00202                                 if(vc != vcur && vc->type == M_APOLAR_AS &&
00203                                    dist(vx, vy, vz, vc->x, vc->y, vc->z)-(vc->ray + vrad) <= 0.) {
00204                                         napol_neigh += 1 ;
00205                                 }
00206 
00207                                 /* Update density by the way... */
00208                                 if(j > i) {
00209                                         dtmp = dist(vcur->x, vcur->y, vcur->z,
00210                                                                 vc->x, vc->y, vc->z);
00211                                         
00212                                         if(dtmp > as_max_dst) as_max_dst = dtmp ;
00213                                         as_density += dtmp ;
00214                                 }
00215                         }
00216                         desc->mean_loc_hyd_dens += (float) napol_neigh ;
00217                         nAlphaApol += 1 ;
00218                 }
00219                 else {
00220                         /* Update density */
00221                         for(j = i+1 ; j < nvert ; j++) {
00222                                 dtmp = dist(vcur->x, vcur->y, vcur->z,
00223                                                         tvert[j]->x, tvert[j]->y, tvert[j]->z) ;
00224                                 
00225                                 if(dtmp > as_max_dst) as_max_dst = dtmp ;
00226                                 as_density += dtmp ;
00227                         }
00228                 }
00229 
00230                 mean_ashape_radius += vcur->ray ;
00231                 /* Estimating solvent accessibility of the sphere */
00232                 d = dist(vcur->x, vcur->y, vcur->z,
00233                                  vcur->bary[0], vcur->bary[1], vcur->bary[2]) ;
00234                 masph_sacc += d/vcur->ray ;
00235         }
00236 
00237         if(nAlphaApol>0) desc->mean_loc_hyd_dens /= (float)nAlphaApol ;
00238         else desc->mean_loc_hyd_dens= 0.0;
00239 
00240         desc->as_max_dst = as_max_dst ;
00241         desc->apolar_asphere_prop = (float)nAlphaApol / (float)nvert ;
00242         desc->masph_sacc =  masph_sacc / nvert ;
00243         desc->mean_asph_ray = mean_ashape_radius / (float)nvert ;
00244         desc->nb_asph = nvert ;
00245         desc->as_density = as_density / ((nvert*nvert - nvert) * 0.5) ;
00246                 
00247         desc->volume = get_verts_volume_ptr(tvert, nvert, niter,-1.6) ;
00248         desc->as_max_r = as_max_r ;
00249 }
00250 
00251 /**
00252    ## FUNCTION: 
00253         get_vert_apolar_density
00254   
00255    ## SPECIFICATION:
00256         Here we calculate the number of apolar vertices (vertices that contact at 
00257         least 3 atoms having their electronegativity > 2.7) that lie within a range 
00258         of 0-r () from a given reference vertice, r being its own radius.
00259  
00260         It provides the apolar density for a given vertice, that will be used for
00261         the calculation of the total apolar density of the pocket, defined as the
00262         mean value of it.
00263   
00264    ## PARAMETRES:
00265         @ s_vvertice **tvert : The list of vertices
00266         @ int nvert             : The number of vertices
00267         @ s_vvertice *vert      : The reference vertice.
00268   
00269    ## RETURN:
00270         int: The apolar density as defined previously.
00271   
00272 */
00273 int get_vert_apolar_density(s_vvertice **tvert, int nvert, s_vvertice *vert)
00274 {
00275         int apol_neighbours = 0,
00276                 i = 0 ;
00277 
00278         s_vvertice *vc = NULL ;
00279 
00280         float vx = vert->x, 
00281                   vy = vert->y,
00282                   vz = vert->z,
00283                   vray = vert->ray ;
00284         
00285         for(i = 0 ; i < nvert ; i++) {
00286                 vc = tvert[i] ;
00287                 if(vc != vert && vc->type == M_APOLAR_AS){
00288                         if(dist(vx, vy, vz, vc->x, vc->y, vc->z)-(vc->ray + vray) <= 0.) {
00289                                 apol_neighbours += 1 ;
00290                         }
00291                 }
00292         }
00293 
00294         return apol_neighbours ;
00295 }
00296 
00297 /**
00298    ## FUNCTION:
00299         set_atom_based_descriptors
00300   
00301    ## SPECIFICATION:
00302         Update atomic descriptors of the pocket for the given atom. Here, we just
00303         update mean bfactor, electronegativity, amino-acids scores...
00304   
00305    ## PARAMETRES:
00306         @ s_atom *atoms : The atoms
00307         @ int natoms    : Number of atoms
00308         @ s_desc *desc  : OUTPUT : The descriptor structure to fill
00309   
00310    ## RETURN:
00311         void
00312   
00313 */
00314 void set_atom_based_descriptors(s_atm **atoms, int natoms, s_desc *desc)
00315 {
00316         s_atm *curatom = NULL ;
00317 
00318         int i,
00319                 res_ids[natoms],        /* Maximum natoms residues contacting the pocket */
00320                 nb_res_ids = 0 ;        /* Current number of residus */
00321 
00322         int nb_polar_atm = 0 ;
00323  
00324         for(i = 0 ; i < natoms ; i++) {
00325                 curatom = atoms[i] ;
00326 
00327         /* Setting amino acid descriptor of the current atom */
00328                 if(in_tab(res_ids,  nb_res_ids, curatom->res_id) == 0) {
00329                         set_aa_desc(desc, atoms[i]->res_name) ;
00330                         res_ids[nb_res_ids] = curatom->res_id ;
00331                         nb_res_ids ++ ;
00332                 }
00333 
00334         /* Setting atom descriptor */
00335                 desc->flex += curatom->bfactor ;
00336                 if(curatom->electroneg > 2.7)  nb_polar_atm += 1 ;
00337         }
00338 
00339         desc->hydrophobicity_score = desc->hydrophobicity_score/ (float) nb_res_ids ;
00340         desc->volume_score = desc->volume_score / (float) nb_res_ids ;
00341 
00342         desc->flex /= natoms ;
00343         desc->prop_polar_atm = ((float) nb_polar_atm) / ((float) natoms) * 100.0 ;
00344 }
00345 
00346 /**
00347    ## FUNCTION: 
00348         set_aa_desc
00349   
00350    ## SPECIFICATION: 
00351         Set amino-acid based descriptors.
00352   
00353    ## PARAMETRES:
00354    @ s_desc *desc        : OUTPUT: Structure of descriptors to fill
00355    @ const char *aa_name : The amino acid name
00356   
00357    ## RETURN:
00358         s_desc*
00359   
00360 */
00361 void set_aa_desc(s_desc *desc, const char *aa_name) 
00362 {       
00363         int aa_idx = -1;
00364         char l1 = aa_name[0], 
00365                  l2 = aa_name[1], 
00366                  l3 = aa_name[2] ;
00367 
00368         /* Ok, lets use the less comparisons possible... (may be used in the aa.c
00369          * file later!) 
00370          * Only A, C, G, H, I, L, M, P, S, T and V possibility for the first letter:
00371          **/
00372         switch(l1) {
00373                 case 'A' : /* Either ALA, ASP, ASN or ARG */
00374                         if(l2 == 'L') aa_idx = M_ALA_IDX ;                              /* ALA amino acid! */
00375                         else if(l2 == 'R') aa_idx = M_ARG_IDX ;                 /* ARG amino acid! */
00376                         else if(l2 == 'S' && l3 ==  'P') 
00377                                 aa_idx = M_ASP_IDX ;                                            /* ASP amino acid! */
00378                         else aa_idx = M_ASN_IDX ; break ;                               /* ASN amino acid! */
00379                         
00380                 case 'C' : aa_idx = M_CYS_IDX ; break ;                         /* CYS amino acid! */
00381                         
00382                 case 'G' : /* Either GLU, GLY, or GLN, so just check the 3rd letter */
00383                         if(l3 == 'U') aa_idx = M_GLU_IDX ;                              /* GLU amino acid! */
00384                         else if(l3 == 'Y') aa_idx = M_GLY_IDX ;                 /* GLY amino acid! */
00385                         else aa_idx = M_GLN_IDX ; break ;                               /* GLN amino acid! */
00386 
00387                 case 'H' : aa_idx = M_HIS_IDX ; break ;                         /* HIS amino acid! */
00388                 case 'I' : aa_idx = M_ILE_IDX ; break ;                         /* ILE amino acid! */
00389                         
00390                 case 'L' : /* Either ALA, ASP, ASN or ARG */
00391                         if(l2 == 'Y') aa_idx = M_LYS_IDX ;                              /* LYS amino acid! */
00392                         else aa_idx = M_LEU_IDX ; break ;                               /* LEU amino acid! */
00393                         
00394                 case 'M' : aa_idx = M_MET_IDX ; break ;                         /* MET amino acid! */
00395                 case 'P' : /* Either ALA, ASP, ASN or ARG */
00396                         if(l2 == 'H') aa_idx = M_PHE_IDX ;                              /* PHE amino acid! */
00397                         else aa_idx = M_PRO_IDX ; break ;                               /* PRO amino acid! */
00398 
00399                 case 'S' : aa_idx = M_SER_IDX ; break ;                         /* SER amino acid! */
00400 
00401                 case 'T' : /* Either ALA, ASP, ASN or ARG */
00402                         if(l2 == 'H') aa_idx = M_THR_IDX ;                              /* THR amino acid! */
00403                         else if(l2 == 'R') aa_idx = M_TRP_IDX ;                 /* TRP amino acid! */
00404                         else aa_idx = M_TYR_IDX ; break ;                               /* TYR amino acid! */
00405 
00406                 case 'V' : aa_idx = M_VAL_IDX ; break ;                         /* VAL amino acid! */
00407 
00408                 default: /*fprintf(stderr, "! Amno acid %s does not exists!\n", aa_name) ;*/ 
00409                         break ;
00410         }
00411 
00412         /* Ok now we have our amino acid, lets update statistics! */
00413 
00414         if(aa_idx != -1) {
00415                 desc->aa_compo[aa_idx] ++ ;
00416 
00417                 desc->hydrophobicity_score += get_hydrophobicity_score_from_idx(aa_idx) ;
00418                 desc->polarity_score += get_polarity_from_idx(aa_idx) ;
00419                 desc->volume_score += get_volume_score_from_idx(aa_idx) ;
00420                 desc->charge_score += get_charge_from_idx(aa_idx) ;
00421         }
00422 }
